Water Pollution.Description: Industrial waste, such as chemicals and toxins, can contaminate water sources and contribute to water pollution.
Excessive use of fertilizers and pesticides in agriculture can lead to runoff, which carries pollutants into water bodies and causes water pollution.
Improperly treated or untreated sewage can release harmful bacteria, viruses, and chemicals into water sources, leading to water pollution.
Accidental or deliberate oil spills can have devastating effects on water ecosystems, causing severe water pollution and harming aquatic life.
